intro: Ionidium enneaspermum var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf ionidium, is a tropical plant characterized by its large, broad leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is native to parts of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its leaves are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties.
